column4: hi, if I want to use nvidia's driver (downloaded from their site)
instead of ubuntu's supplied one.. what should I do?
why do you want to use the one from nvidia.com?
because it has a fix to a problem Ihave with my card
you can try use PPA's with the latest -180 driver in them
its slightly safer then just getting them from nvidia.com
fyi it's this fix I need: "Fixed a regression that could result in window decoration corruption when running Compiz using Geforce 6 and 7 series GPUs."

https://launchpad.net/~thomas-creutz/+archive add that to your /etc/apt/sources.list and then do sudo apt-get update. After that you need to remove your current nvidia drivers with sudo apt-get remove nvidia-<whatevertheyare> and then do sudo apt-get install nvidia-180*
I then get an error message saying: "E: The method driver /usr/lib/apt/metods/https could not be found."
err you did actually click on the link and get the deb and deb-src lines from there right?
hmm, it says it's "180.18" and the one on nvidia's page is "180.22", I wonder if it will have the fix? probaby not?
thanks, it seems to have fixed the problem with the titlebars
